summary:
The Security Council:

Reaffirms previous resolutions and statements on Somalia, stressing full compliance and implementation.
Reaffirms respect for Somalia's sovereignty, territorial integrity, political independence, and unity.

Welcomes the conclusion of the electoral process, election of President Hassan Sheikh Mohamud, and peaceful transition of power. 

Emphasizes the essential role of UNSOM in supporting the Federal Government of Somalia (FGS) and Federal Member States.

1. Decides to extend UNSOM's mandate until 31 October 2022 as set out in resolution 2158 (2014).
2. Requests the Secretary-General to provide regular updates and written reports every 90 days, with the next report due by 31 August.
3. Requests a strategic review of UNSOM to include measurable benchmarks to track its execution and achievement of its mandate, to be reported by 30 September 2022.
4. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
